content: quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: Amidst the racial naysayers during WWII, the first African-American fighter pilots were commissioned in 1941 to help defend distressed bombers in the European theater. Known as the Tuskegee Airmen, these forgotten pilots fought with bravery and skill to save lives and prevent the loss of bombers to enemy fighters. Tuskegee Airmen of World War II The Fifteenth's Red Tail Angels 'http://www.tuskegeeairmen.org/' 'http://www.globalindex.com/kwanzaa/tuskegee/red_tail_angels.htm' You got it, Redtails were the Tuskeegee Airman of WWII Fame. The F-16D escort came from Alabama's 187th Fighter Wing. http://www.almont.ang.af.mil/default.htm Now why would you need an escort fighter from Alabama for a New York City Flight, when Macguire AFB in New Jersey is 30 Minutes away as the crow flies,and the 177th Fighter Wing NJ ANG is based out of Atlantic City, NJ? Odd, Aint it?

content: quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: Amidst the racial naysayers during WWII, the first African-American fighter pilots were commissioned in 1941 to help defend distressed bombers in the European theater. Known as the Tuskegee Airmen, these forgotten pilots fought with bravery and skill to save lives and prevent the loss of bombers to enemy fighters. Tuskegee Airmen of World War II The Fifteenth's Red Tail Angels 'http://www.tuskegeeairmen.org/' 'http://www.globalindex.com/kwanzaa/tuskegee/red_tail_angels.htm' You got it, Redtails were the Tuskeegee Airman of WWII Fame. The F-16D escort came from Alabama's 187th Fighter Wing. http://www.almont.ang.af.mil/default.htm Now why would you need an escort fighter from Alabama for a New York City Flight, when Macguire AFB in New Jersey is 30 Minutes away as the crow flies,and the 177th Fighter Wing NJ ANG is based out of Atlantic City, NJ? Odd, Aint it?
